Config.overview: This course will teach you the essentials of parachuting, including the gear, jump and emergency procedures

Module.name: M1: Equipment

Lesson.name: The Parachute Rig
Lesson.desc: Includes the dual canopy system, main ripcord and reserve handle.

Module.Lesson: Teaching Content for this lesson: - Dual canopy system: explain that the rig has a main and reserve. These should be inspected yearly. - Main Ripcord: Explain what it does. Located right side, chest height. Pull outwards with right-hand, not crossbody. - Reserve Handle: Silver Handle, Located left side, hip height. Visual Resources for this lesson: - [[CAT-GEAR-01_chute_overview.jpg]] Overview diagram of parachute. - [[CAT-GEAR-01_chute_handles.jpg]] Diagram of parachute focussing on handle colour and location. Test Scenario - The student is at the dropzone, and they are given a new parachute. What should they check for, and where will they find it?

Lesson.name: Altimeter & Height Windows
Lesson.desc: Tools and techniques for descent management

Module.Lesson: Teaching Content for this lesson: - Check Cadence: We need to be checking our altimeter every 5 seconds during freefall - Correct Setting For Drop Zone: Always set Altimeter so that zero matches dropzone elevation. - Decision Window: 5,000ft AGL is the start of the Decision Window, reaching down to 3,000 feet - Mandatory Deployment Altitude: 3,000ft AGL. Essential parachute is deployed to allow time to reserve deployment in case of failure. Visual Resources for this lesson: - [[CAT-GEAR-02_altimeter_example.jpg]] - Example image of a wrist altimeter. - [[CAT-GEAR-02_decision_window.jpg]] - Diagram of the decision window, showing altitude heights. Test Scenario - The student is at 6,000 feet. What are their actions over the next few seconds?

Module.name: M2: Environment
Module.Lesson: Teaching Content for this lesson: - Cumulonimmbus: These clouds cabn be lethal for jumpers due to updrafts, turbluence, rain, hail etc. Jumping is prohibited if there are cumulonimbus clouds within 10 miles of the dropzone. - Cloud Cover: No boarding if cloud cover is below 2,000ft AGL - Max Wind Speed at DZ: Maximum ground wind speed at drop zone of 20 knots Visual Resources for this lesson: - [[CAT-ENV-01_cunim.jpg]] Ref Image of cunim (thunderhead) cloud formation. - [[CAT-ENV-01_cloud_cover.jpg]] Ref Image of low cloud over dropzone. Test Scenario - The student is at the dropzone, on a cloudy and blustery day. What should they check for?

Lesson.name: Water Landings
Lesson.desc: The dangers and correct SOP for coming down in water

Module.Lesson: Teaching Content for this lesson: - Dangers of Water Landing: Landing in water is a dangerous activity. Jumpers has become cocooned in the chute fabric and lines and have drowned. - Water Landing SOP: Airborne Action: Unclip chest strap. Water Contact Action: Unclip leg straps only upon touching water. Reasoning: Prevents harness fall-out while avoiding cocooning. Visual Resources for this lesson: [[CAT-ENV-02_water_dangers.jpg]] Example image of a parachute in the water. [[CAT-ENV-02_water_land_SOP.jpg]] Diagram of the correct approach to a water landing. Test Scenario - The student is at 1,500 feet in a coastal location. An offshore wind is blowing. What are their actions over the next few minutes?
